reviews.review: single is quite short and multi is cool, game is worth to play with friends, its so much fun!

To be fair, you have to have a very high IQ to understand Portal. The gameplay is incredibly advanced, and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the puzzles will go over a typical player's head. There's also GLaDOS's nihilistic outlook, which is deftly woven into her characterisation- her personal philosophy draws heavily from Narodnaya Volya literature, for instance. The fans understand this stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of her jokes, to realise that they're not just funny- they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike Portal truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldn't appreciate, for instance, the humour in GLaDOS's catchphrase "You Monster," which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenev's Russian epic Fathers and Sons. I'm smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Erik Wolpaw's genius wit unfolds itself on their monitors. What fools.. how I pity them. ğŸ˜‚

And yes, by the way, i DO have a Cave Jhonson tattoo. And no, you cannot see it. It's for the ladies' eyes only- and even then they have to demonstrate that they're within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand. Nothin personnel kid ğŸ˜

Play the first one, then play Portal Stories : MEL and leave this one for last. Yet again, Valve does not dissapoint with the quality of the gameplay, the story and the depth of each character. Simply an amazing game that is a must-play for everyone out there.
Um dos melhores jogos da historia. vale muito a pena jogar esse game.
fiquei com nausea e enjoo, e ate vomitei, mais vale apena .-.
10/10 would drown the long leggy boi again

Great Game!
Its Portal but better and has co-op
Bought this game 90% off it is a steal!!

Not only is this game a great sequel, it's a great stand-alone game. In addition, the co-op mode is tons of fun and very well-made, and that alone is worth getting this game on sale. As is, absolutely worth the full price and the replayability of this game is quite high (especially with new friends and the co-op experience).
This is a Must have game if your into Puzzles at all. The humor can be a bit dark at times but I like it.

After 7 years, I finally deicided to pick up this game. I replayed the first portal just so I had an idea of the story.

And ho boy, was the wait totally worth it.

I forgot how good this game was when it came to new tech for the source engine, how good it looked in general, and how amazing the story was.

If you are looking to get a fantastic puzzle game with story rich content. I would highly suggest getting this game.

Full price, or not, its worth every penny!
Excelente juego!!!, uno de los mejores que he jugado!

Portal is back, bigger and better.

+ More puzzle elements and cool mechanics
+ Great sense of humor
+ Wheatly is a fantastic and funny character
+ Greater insight into the story of Portal

There's not much else to write really... It's more of the same great portal puzzles and humor, and it's better in every way. No negatives...

Beeshu - June 2018

nice game. still waiting for portal3

Portal 2 is a hilarious puzzle game that makes you want to continue playing for all of eternity. It has an amazing sense of humour and completing levels is one of the most accomplishing things ever. This game has a very low price and honestly could be alot more expensive. The saying "bang for your buck" doesn't even apply to this, since this is an absolute steal. I would recommend it anyone thats looking for a great game.

Okay where do I start with this one. You already know how good this game is. because you've bought it several times over and played it twice on each platform you own it on. Portal 2 is exceptional. It's not a great puzzle game, but it's atmosphere and voice acting make it so amazingly immesive and engrossing. If you haven't played this or it's prequel then do yourself a favor and pick it up.

This is quite literally my favorite game. The puzzles are so well done, and don't require hand holding, but at the same time they're still challenging. This is worth picking up at any price, the same goes for the first, but Valve's story stucture really shines in this one. It also give a look in to the beginning and fall of Aperature Labs, which is a pleasant ride. GET. THIS. GAME.
